definitions.definition: one of the official areas of a country that elects someone to represent it in a parliament or legislature:
the people who live and can vote in a particular area:
examples: He angered his constituency by voting against the bill.

definitions.definition: a group of people who support, or are likely to support, a particular person, product, suggestion, etc. :
examples: There is a large constituency in favour of income-tax reductions.
